item.title: The Next Decade of Bandwidth - Part IV
item.description: The most desirable wireless frequencies will soon be completely allocated. These prime frequencies, ranging from a few hundred to a few thousand MHz, offer high bandwidth, strong building penetration, and accommodate small antennas. The problem is that the number of these channels is finite. Similar to real estate, once the best spots are taken, expansion continues into less ideal areas. Finding more bandwidth means moving up or down the electromagnetic spectrum, which presents challenges.
